description: Food was good if you're at lunch and in a hurry. This isn't really the restaurant sit down and eat. The flavors I actually liked. I'd come here again. The only feedback I have is that the food wasn't hot. Luke warm isn't the same as hot food.
author: Sean V.

description: I bought a bbq chicken rice, the chicken cooked too old. Also ordered the vegetable but only gave me two broccolis. Totally not worth $11 :(
author: Yueshan Z.

description:
We came to the Metreon a bit early before our movie. I haven't been here in a long time, but I remembered that they had a small food court here before. Out of all the options, Sorabol stood out to us so we decided to check it out.

Usually the food at mall food courts isn't very good. I also didn't want to pay a huge amount of money for not-so-good food, especially considering I always spend $15+ at the Westfield food court, but the prices here are actually pretty affordable for SF standards. I decided to get the BBQ chicken with half sweet potato noodles, half white rice, and some broccoli and kimchi. It was so ridiculously good! I actually don't like sweet potatoes, but the noodles were great and filling. I also felt a bit better knowing they are a bit healthier than regular noodles. I highly recommend them!
author: Karen R.

description: Ate here today on a whim because it's close to Moscone North. I ordered the "customer favorite" BBQ chicken. It was totally mediocre. Nothing was particularly hot and everything was fine, but not much more. It's a waste to eat such food in a city teeming with incredible restaurants. Next time I'll choose more carefully. My recommendation: Skip it.
author: Michael F.

description: I like Korean food and Korean BBQ. It's one of my favorite foods. This is the fast food version of Korean BBQ. I do like the noodles but the chicken is dry and tough to chew on.
author: Juan V.

description:
This review is only for the 'black bean noodle' - avoid it.  
The 'black bean noodle' is nothing like the original Chinese-Korean kind of noodle - the sauce, the ingredients are all wrong except the color.  The cost is $10 but it is not even worth $2 IMO.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this particular item.
author: Brian L.

description:
Surprisingly the Sorabol in Meteron tastes a bit better than the one in Westfield. The difference isn't that great but the preparation on this side is a bit better. 

That being said, if you get Meal Pal, it is somewhat prepacked in that they made the chicken and egg roll meal for us, but it is sealed in a black plastic container. Still the food was acceptable and it didn't taste like microwaved food or anything.

The egg roll was okay, if you drenched it in the sweet and sour sauce it just taste like fried sweet takeout Chinese food. The meat wasn't too bad, it was sweet and tasty but could have been better.

Overall a so-so choice.
author: Tyler T.

description: I would give this "0" stars if possible. A couple of us ate here and were sick with food poisoning afterwards - we each had different dishes. I did not see the health score posted, but maybe I missed it. It is 85/100 as listed on Yelp and verified on SF's website (snapshot attached). Definitely will steer clear of this place in the future.
author: Tanya V.

description: Workers are outrageously rude and stingy with their food! For the price we are paying, they can't even give us a little more veggies or something? There was literally 4 pieces of veggies given to us... a small portion of rice, and an extremely small and dry piece of salmon. Not worth the money at all. I would have felt better if the customer service wasn't so awful. Will NEVER be back! STOP BEING SO STINGY WITH YOUR FOOD! I can go somewhere and get twice as much food for half the price! Nearly $20 for a small bowl of food fit for the stomach of a toddler. That's not how you keep customers. FIX YOUR SH*T AND GET BETTER EMPLOYEES!
author: Michelle T.

description: What a nice find at the food court. Not the same old stuff.  I had the kalbi beef ribs... Good portions 4 pieces and a bunch of sides included.  Flavor wise... It was in the sweet side... But the meet was tender as it should be.  Tanned the sweetened with the Kim chi.  I probably could have used a little more rice.  Good meal not too expensive considering. Also had a lemon chicken but it seemed more like chilly chicken... Not what I usually have as lemon chicken
author: William L.

description: I honestly really liked my experience at Sorabol at the Metreon. Usually, food court quality is terrible and I'm always expecting poor to mediocre food, but the Vegetable Bowl (Bibimbap) that I ordered was quite delicious and had a greater variety of vegetables than what I usually see at other Korean places. The flavor was excellent and the portion was large. I went during a time when there wasn't a line, so service was quick and the lady helping me was nice and answered my questions about the menu.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
Place - it is in the metreon food court. Easy to find, it is yellow sign board. The menu is less the sorabol in West Field. There are many seats in metreon. 

Taste - soso. Less delicious and less choice of food than sorabol in West Field. There are also many kind of soups. I odered seafood tufu soup. I needed to wait 10 mins to get it. The taste is good. Many ingredents in it. Amout is pretty a lot. They also offered free side kimchi. Also rice was included. You can choose white rice or brown rice. 

Service and Price - the service was great. They were nice and kind. Price is not expensive. It is reasonable.
author: Da Won L.

description:
Very disappointed in my visit. So came here instead of the Westfield location, heard lines weren't as bad and service was better. 

So I ordered my BBQ chicken lunch. When it moved to the next area, the waitress took the order of the person in front of me for my order when they didn't even order anything at all. So my BBQ chicken came with some broccoli and kim chee that I didn't even want.
author: M C.

description:
Okay place to get a quick lunch... There are usually long lines during the lunch rush everywhere else around the Metreon, but very little inside the actual building. This is probably why: 

Got a combo plate with stir-fry tofu, noodles, rice, kimchi and broccoli. My broccoli was practically frozen! It was completely cold - and not the 'raw' kind of cold. The just-taken-out-of-the-freezer cold!? I thought I was supposed to receive steamed veggies? Also...most of the pans are warmed aren't they? I don't even know. It was not good at all to bite into an icy piece of broccoli. I noticed that another girl was picking hers out as well and putting them to the side... so it wasn't just my broccoli... ugh.

Other than that...everything else was cooked, warm, and edible. The glass noodles and kimchi were probably my favorite part.

Can't expect too much from a fast food location - but it's really not that bad a spot for fast Korean food if you look past the frozen broccoli.
author: Shanise M.

description:
As a Korean, I was pleasantly surprised that the galbi was pretty tender and had just a little bit of the chewy, annoying fat. The lunch portion had 3 strips, but the price tag was $15! Kind of a lot, but it was a good meal. 

Their kimchi was good too. Well above average and had the real stemmy parts of the cabbage, not just the leafy parts. The bean sprouts and japchae added good variety. I could each this meal everyday if it were 2 strips for $10!
author: Young Y.

description: A convenient location in the Metreon and rapid service makes this a tempting option for Asian food near Yerba Buena, but its fare is mediocre at best. The kalbi (which is $2 extra) was pretty tough and grisly, and while the flavor was there, the difficulty eating the rib made it hard to enjoy. The bugolgi was also a bit overcooked, with chewy texture overpowering the decent flavor. Service is very polite and if it's not a busy day you're through in less than a minute. There is ample seating both inside and outside the food area.
author: Albert W.

description:
Solid for Korean fast food! I'm not sure why this place has garnered so much negativity. Granted, this was my first time here so it may have been a unique situation. What really contributed to my rating being 4 stars and not just 3 was the excellent service we experienced. The lady who helped us was super friendly, which is always pleasantly surprising for a food court. She greeted us as we walked up, offered us a sample of lemon chicken, and even granted me a sample of a different chicken when I requested it. She also let me substitute more japchae for rice in my combo! 

I've been to the Sorabol in Westfield Mall (San Francisco City Center) and I would have to say this one was much better. We dined in at this location at 1pm on a Monday and there wasn't much of a line. I really like the Metreon food court. 

I would recommend their lemon chicken.
author: Emma W.

description: This place is in a big food court.. the food is good and staff are friendly.. a bit noisy the food court and crowded.. good to have a fast food..
author: Ray K.

description:
We ordered black bean noodle with spicy pork and the veggie bowl with spicy tofu.

Veggie bowl: spicy tofu is good. The rice was not "sticky" or short grain like I'm used to when eating bibimbap. Veggies were good and well-seasoned.

Black bean: noodles were a bit on the mushy side but overall flavor was good. Spicy pork was good.

For it being food court food, it's not bad. For the quality I would expect this place to be 2-3 bucks cheaper. Also, ordering anything  other than a bowl will require a longer wait. Not too excited to come back.
author: Lupita D.

description:
After drinking nearby, a group of us were looking for a place to eat. After a fail at our first stop, we decided to go to the Metreon and grab dinner. It was Saturday, February 27th around 7:15pm.

I wanted to try a new place, so I picked Sorabol. Ended up getting the 2 item combination ($11). The combo comes with rice, sweet potato noodles, vegetables and kimchee. Since I'm not a big rice person, I got two helpings of noodles. I'm off red meat right now, so I picked the Spicy bbq chicken and Mackerel fillet (pan seared). The chicken was okay. Not really spicy, but the pieces I got were tender. I did find the sauce a little too thick for my liking. The mackerel was all right. A touch overcooked, but good flavor. The noodles had a good chew. The vegetable was broccoli which I enjoyed as it still had a nice crunch.

Easy and quick Korean fast food if you will. I love the intense flavors of Korean dishes. Sorabol seems to be a bland, dulled downed version of the mainstream dishes I know. At least it's decently priced.
author: Elena N.

description: The fat girl was rude gave me little pieces of chicken cold, .portion over all is way smaller than west field shopping center not worth ten $. She didn't care about making me happy  stop cutting the chicken up n skimpping our plates so u don't gotta cookore won't be back and thanks for the whole bottle of soy sauce ..
author: Jeannine P.

description:
ate here yesterday for lunch around 1pm, got home at 4pm and had food poisoning.

safe to say, I'll never be eating here again. 

plus,  the Westfield location portion is way bigger
author: Robby S.

description: I went to get at veggie bowl with salmon. The salmon was getting grilled, it looked great then they put it on top of my veggies and it was mostly raw. They disappeared and deep fried the salmon! Who deep fries salmon?!? I asked them what they did and they disappeared and returned with a new bowl of veggies and more fried salmon. Not returning
author: Kim A.

description: Mediocre seafood noodle soup, but I'm not expecting too much from it either. There were plenty of clams and other seafood, but the soup just tastes like diluted soy sauce.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Come here for that on-the-go quicky lunch stop. Delivering proper quality and fast service to get you in and out of the line with a nice Korean meal. They have their flavoring down with their items. A go-to for me is the spicy bulgogi, and the banchan. Every plate comes with a few pieces of steamed broccoli (which is always steamed perfectly and never too salty or mushy) and a nice scoop of traditional kimchi. My 4-stars comes from the portion sizes. Every single time I come here, I don't know why they don't remember me as the guy that always ask for a little more kimchi, but they always give a little skimpy portion for my plates. Always! And I'm a pretty regular customer since my school is right across the street. But other than the skimpy portion of kimchi, their flavors and fast services are solely why I gave them a 4-star review. Thank you Sorabol!
author: Nick A.

description:
Yelp 2017 100 Challenge:
2017 Review 15/100

Decently priced Korean food at the malls in/near the Union Square area of SF! We went several times to both locations during our trip. Depending on the dish, it is either very good or complete pass.

Good:
Soft Tofu Stews
Yukgejang Stew

Pass:
Bibimpbab (they actually laid out all the ingredients on a plate. We could barely mix all the ingredients and eat comfortable. Who gives this dish out on a plate? Did they run out of bowls or something?)
-Tofu Vegetable Noodle Soup (no flavor at all)
-Beef Noodle Soup (weak flavor)
author: Linda S.

description: I hope they give bigger portions next time. My 2 entrees look like it's not worth it. but the food is good
author: Kate C.

description:
For Korean fast food- this is pretty good.

And when A sale force convention isn't going on- you can actually eat downtown and fit a seat!

This place is in the food court by the AMC & Target.

Came here for an early lunch at 12:15pm and didn't have to wait in line- yay.

With us finally getting some rain in SF- I was craving soft tofu soup- so chose that ($10.88 & comes with a side white/brown rice)

The soup was great- bits of clams, mussels, shrimp, zucchini, onions,& mushrooms. The broth is super spicy and was made to order so was blazing hot- but just the way I'd like it. If you're not a fan of spicy broths I wouldn't choose this. 

Portions are generous and price is reasonable. Heck you can hardly any place in downtown SF for lunch under $10, but this was just a tiny bit over. 

Seems like a good place for both vegetarians and carnivores alike. Vegetarian options include the bibimbap and spicy tofu from the entrees , while the there is a healthy selection of meat including bbq chicken and prime rib. I saw there was salmon fillets as well but I think these don't sell as fast and so I'd choose differently.
author: Ruby S.

description: Ok only reason I'm putting 2 stars is because while I was looking what to get. One of the employees put back some noodles that where already in a box.. it was discussing. I've come here in the past, I've always thought the food was good. But now idk.
author: Eva J.

description: Spicy sauce that is actually spicy! Delicious. A good amount of food on the entrees. My only complaint: the spicy pork is TOO fatty so the sauce is very greasy. Please trim the fat. Very nice service--
author: B. L.

description:
Most people get the BBQ chicken and overcooked beef, so they're probably the safest options here (in terms of freshness). I guess the other meat choices are seldom picked, so u get old meat.

I ordered a combo plate with BBQ chicken and spicy pork. Bad choice, the pork wasn't fresh (starting to spoil, like week old leftovers). I think the Russian girls serving me knew that the pork was funky, because she pushed each individual piece of pork deep into the sauce, swirling, before placing each piece on my plate. Now I know why. But the extra saucing couldn't disguise that spoiled pork meat. The rest of my food: white rice, jap chae, chicken, broccoli, fried dumplings, were okay.

So far, Rincon Center (store #1) is the only location serving decent food for me. I've experienced bad food at all other Sorabol branches. I'm never eating at this location again.
author: Luis C.

description: Lemon chicken is good. Tried the sampler. But this isn't a Korean food. I ordered the soft tofu seafood soup. The soup was not as tasty as I exoected. It is spicy though and a bit more salt than what I would expect. But then again, this is a food court passing out as Korean food.
author: Adrian A.

description: Paid so much money for literally one damn piece of meat. Can't eat a full meal without going broke here.
author: Brian W.

description: This Korean place has some of the best salmon I have ever tasted. I've seen many reviews on the wait... I don't know what they're talking about! MY usual wait time is 6 minutes at most! Everything else on the menu is pretty good too. I could never eat here without boba. The location is amazing because Sharetea is very close to Sorabol. Salmon and Oolong Milk Tea with Lychee Jelly and Boba are a great combo. I hope you liked my review!
author: Juan Pablo C.

description: This is so good . I ordered shrimp noodle. It has many many shrimp may be 10 pieces or over.
author: Jisoo Y.

description: Stir Fry Noodles with Beef - Should have been called stir fry soggy cabbage with rotten meat and a noddle.
author: Miles G.

description:
A really nice food court Korean restaurant near the Moscone. They have a variety of dishes you can get from the buffet or they have many items like noodle soups made to order. 

The food packs a punch and tastes pretty authentic. I went for the spicy options and the seafood was quite well cooked and tasty. 

I would come back here again for a quick meal. It's reasonably priced good quality Korean food.
author: Sam S.

description:
My sister and I decided to stop for food in the mall and randomly chose this place after finding out our favorite brunch place was closed and because we were a little disappointed by that, this place picked us up the slightest bit! 

We both had gone for their one entree bowls (I had gone for the veggie that came with pickled veggies and some steamed and she got the short ribs that came with your choice of rice, clear noodles/japchae, and kimchi). It was pretty mediocre food but they give you a lot so it can easily be saved for the next meal! 
(I distinctly remember the japchae being the best thing of all we ordered though!) 

One thing I particularly did not like about this place was their kimchi. I wasn't expecting much because c'mon ... It's a restaurant in a mall ... But it was really, extremely, disappointing. Kimchi at grocery stores are better than this. It was extremely sour and wasn't soaked in enough but I guess you have to work with what you have to feed the masses. 

All in all, come if you have a strong crave for Korean food and can't get it anywhere else at the moment.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Pretty mediocre korean food place

What did you expect? This is a fast food counter at the food court. Actually, given that it's a food court, the food quality is actually not that bad. There is a wide selection of meat sides to choose from, and the food quality is pretty good--nothing bad that I was aware of when I tried it. Also, the portions are pretty big.

Overall, it's a-ok
author: Henry L.

description:
I've always been a big fan of Sorabol, having enjoyed the Emeryville location as well as their original, but now gone, Oakland sit-down restaurant.

I had the BBQ chicken rice plate.  The marinade they use is very tasty.  It's a generous portion and reasonably priced.

I would definitely come back if I'm looking for lunch at the Metreon again.
author: Dan L.

description:
Consistently excellent beef, chicken, kimchi, japchae glass noodles, and vegetable "bancha" selection ranging from spinach to daikon to mung bean sprouts.  Also, excellent beef dumpling soup. Wander further afield and the fish is a bit dry.

The strength of this place is the grilled meats, not the seafood soups. Beef is the best across the board, whether grilled or stewed or dumplings in spicy soup.  It's the perfect warm up lunch for our foggy, chilly San Francisco summer days. Thanks, Sorabol!
author: Nan L.

description: I don't usually comment on restaurants but I have to say the manager Lydia, service was out of the park. I wanted to get my usual cause I always go to the one in the mall and get bbq chicken and beef stew. Which is an amazing combo! But this location didn't have it at the moment and i was devastated. Lydia then offered if I had 5 mins to kill and she will have the stew ready for me. I was so happy that she catered to my needs and was super polite. Then beside me someone ordered some dim sum and she checked them and said to the guest its not as fresh so she offered if they what fresh ones and as anyone would do they took that offer. I saw her cook them her self while i was waiting for my food. What an amazing person! Anyways I just had to post this. It totally made my day!
author: Zachary A.

description: If I were to be very honest and blunt, the wonton noodle soup I ordered here was garbage. Complete garbage. It's the worst I've ever had in my life. I can honestly make this myself at home. What kind of restaurant sell soup that uses instant noodles? This was a huge turn off! Not to mention, the taste was completely off. It's as though they threw random vegetables inside (I.e. mushrooms) and mixed it with the powdered seasoning that instant noodles usually come in with. I haven't tried their other dishes but from what I've experienced, this place is terrible. It's a complete robbery as the soup was pricey. Avoid at all costs.
author: Jeanne P.

description:
If you find yourself here and thinking about some quickie Korean I've got two words for you:  Westfield Centre.  You're literally within a 5-minute walk of the same place with far better and fresher food and far more inviting servers.  Put one foot in front of the other and head there.

I had the BBQ chicken plate (under $10) accompanied by glass noodles, white rice, and kimchi and was left with the impression that the food had been sitting there for a while.  It wasn't bad, but nor was it great.  And I've been to their place at Westfield Centre where the food is good and fresh (there's probably a lot more customers coming through at Westfield).  I think the servers even smile at Westfield.  

The reimagined, ground-level set-up of the Metreon food-court seems to attract more mental health cases than the sub-terranean food-court at Westfield.  In my book, this is another plus for Westfield and minus for Metreon.  I recognize that comment has little to do with Sorabol, but it could affect who you wind up seated by as you try to consume your meal.  

Sorabol at Metreon?  No.  Sorabol at Westfield Centre?  Yes.  It's that simple.
author: Tracey A.

description:
It makes me really sad how horrible this place has gotten. 

I rarely come to the mall but today I did and I was craving some good ol Korean BBQ. 

But honestly screw Sorabol. I dont understand why they would charge you for two items when im getting the same portion but two different things but its still chicken. Not to mention the other half was wayyyyy less than the first. 

The flavor of the spicy chicken has changed and is sweet and not so spicy anymore. 

I wont be coming back to sorabol ever again. 
Thanks for killing my lunch.
author: Viviana M.

description: The food here wasn't good. I'll not be coming back.  There were only two dishes that looked good, the one I tried was barely mediocre.
author: Mark W.

description:
Really great noodles, affordable prices and large portions. I myself ordered the spicy pork and it was fairly good, nothing to write home about. The quality is about what you would expect in a food court and is thus far from restaurant/food truck eating. However the iced tea was good and I enjoyed is a lot.

Overall, I would go here again if I found myself in a food court looking for a meal.
author: Andrew S.

description:
People don't dine at the new Metreon, they eat...usually with a fork in one hand and a cellphone in the other. At least it's better than the virtual tomb it was six months ago when it was suffering an identity crisis, but now with the new Target in plain view now, there will be a lot more foot traffic here. This stripped-down Sorabol will continue to be a beneficiary even though I find this one the least satisfying of the mini-chain. I think it has to do with the counter staff they've hired here, a daisy chain of service indifference. They always look so bored and look at me like I just woke them up. That's too bad since the older woman who is doing the cooking in the back looks like she's working like a dog to make sure everything is prepared correctly.

I've tried a couple of things here because I was growing tired of the rotating collection in the adjacent Soup Company kiosk. The first dish I had was the $7.95 Vegetable & Tofu Rice Noodle Soup, which was actually not half-bad, a truly lighter option with plenty of tofu cubes if you are looking to curb your calories while satisfying your hunger (see photo). When I came back this past Sunday, I tried the $8.95 Spicy Tofu Stew with Seafood, which was true to its billing - quite spicy. It would have been nice if one of those apathetic counter girls gave me a choice of temperature, but no, I got a full-blast furnace whether I liked it or not. Luckily I did, and it was nice to run into a shrimp once in a while in the broth as well as the big green mussel in the middle (see photo). Nonetheless, it was hearty eating for an asbestos tongue like mine.

FOOD - 3 stars...solid soups served here
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...it's a food court...what ambiance?
SERVICE - 2 stars...have you got something better to do?
TOTAL - 3 stars...saved by the older woman in the back
author: Ed U.

description:
You want quick, cheap Korean food that doesn't taste terrible, and come in decent portions? This is the place for you. It may not be the quality of a restaurant or food truck, but it around $10-12 for an entree plate (rice, meat, noodles, veggies, and kimchi), and doesn't skimp on portions. 

Its slightly above the level of "Korean Panda Express". This is a food court restaurant, and pretty decent for that. Definitely recommend for pre-movie lunch or dinner.
author: Phil L.

description: Good choice for fast food court Korean food for ~$10. Great price for a good amount of food and lots of choices to satisfy your Korean cravings. I got the chop chae, tofu and spicy marinated chicken. All dishes were fresh, with good flavors. The spicy chicken had a good amount of spice. No complaints.
author: Christie L.

description: Spicy pork is pretty good.  Rice is overcooked.  Vermicelli (chap chae) has nothing in it except noodles.  It is flavorless but disgustingly sweet.  You only get kim chee and broccoli as side dishes but they are pretty good.  So yes, have a lot of room for improvement but it's 10 bucks.
author: Hyon Ju P.

description: The BBQ Chicken was good, as well as the clear noodles! They should consider Kid Sizes. My son wanted Soup and they only have the mega bowl size and it's very hot when presented. The kimchi was ok, my wife liked it. So she ate mine.
author: Gregg N.

description: Sorabol Korean BBQ and Asian Noodles is located inside of the food court. I was hungry and decided to give this place a try. I didn't know what to expect (first time eating here). I had a spicy chicken meal which came with vegetables and noodles. Sorabol chicken wasn't overly spicy which was perfect for me. I thought the food was good for mall dining. The portion size was very filling. It's definitely good bang for your buck. Staff was friendly and service was fast. I would return if I was in the mood for Asian food while shopping. I give Sorabol Korean BBQ & Asian Noodles a 3.5 rating.
author: Dominic B.

description:
We went there for a quick lunch, the food was alright and as expected of a food court. We got the 2 Entree Meals which came with rice, noodles, 2 pieces of broccoli and some kimchi. My fiance asked for double portions of the noodle which was met with some resistance but eventually the server gave in. 

The beef, which I assumed was bulgogi, was piping hot and served generously. I wanted the galbi, but they only gave one piece per order. The Spicy chicken and Tofu were saucy and tender, definitely need to supplement this with rice.

It's good for a quick bite especially if you have a craving for Korean food, if not this place is an easy pass for something like Coriander just down the hall.
author: Yang L.

description: The flavors here are popping good. My favorite it's the short rib meal. I'm not crazy about the clear noodle, but it's okay. I wish they gave out a wee bit more veggies (3 tiny broccoli heads), super tiny!
author: Gwen H.

description: A-ok, it's getting better, good selection, lots of salad choices, bbq chicken was good. My favorite Sorabol is in the mall food court, but I would come back to this one if I was shopping at Target and needed a Sorabol fix.
author: Maile N.

description: Sorabol is the Panda Express of Korean food.
author: Amy C.

description: Vegetable and tofu noodle soup: decrepit veggies drowning in miso-scented water. The fresh tofu is definitely the star, but overall, this dish makes cup o' noodles seem gourmet.
author: Be F.

description: Bad service;( the lady only focused on getting as many customers started as possible and rejected to finish their line of service. My plate was pushed to the cashier while it's half empty. The food was ok but the service was not pleasing.
author: Yating L.

description:
The food is delicious! The staff is great also, especially the manager, Walter! He is very helpful and responsive. I had lost my receipt and I needed it for expenses and he immediately helped send me a copy.

BBQ beef is yummy :)
author: Irina V.

description:
I have been going to Sorabol in the Emeryville Public Market over 10 years, back when it was the hottest food stand in that food court. Times have changed since Bay Street was built in Emeryville.

Then I found Sorabol in Sun Valley Mall, and it was a let down because it was different and it disoriented me for a bit. 

Now there is this Sorabol in the new Metreon Food Court. It has some of the same items and flavors, like the chicken bowl, etc., but has its own twist to what I remember way back when. 

I guess it is a franchise chain trying to bring fast food concepts to Korean food. Or is it Korean Food to fast food concepts? 

It hasn't found the secret formula Asian fast food success, like Panda Express has, but they have been at it longer. This is more like the Pho franchise of Pho Hoa, you know, those with the green and red colored menus. It is a franchise too. You didn't know that? Not sure what sort of support in exchange for a royalty payment Pho Hoa gives, but it is looser than Panda Express, which may be company owned, not franchised. I am not sure. 

But Sorabol gives you a hint of Korean flavors with their meat bowls, optional kimchi, and their "sauce" they poor on your meat and rice. 

The thing that is similar with all of them, is that they always seem to have a large grilled filled with chicken cooking on it. 

There was one older Korean lady, presumably the owner working here, other wise, there were young people from all sorts of background working here. So I guess the franchisee can hire who they want. Whereas every Panda Express I have ever been in, they have Asian women serving you, and Latino men frying in all up in the wok.
author: Wanugee N.

description: Whenever I come in for an advance screening at Metreon which requires me to wait at least 2 hours in line, I almost always stop by this Sorabol location to grab a bbq bowl to munch on while waiting.  I'd say out of all the vendors at Metreon's food court, their BBQ Chicken Bowl is one of the best 'bang for your buck' deals for under $10.  You get a big bowl with a generous amount of BBQ Chicken over a bed of rice or japchae (I usually ask for half and half) topped with House BBQ Sauce, steamed broccoli, and kimchee.  That's plenty of food to hold me over during those long wait times for advance screenings.  I haven't really tried anything else from them other than their bulgogi, but I don't think there's a need for me to since their BBQ Bowls are good enough for me and they've been pretty quick to put it together.  So if you're at the Metreon and are looking for something substantial for lunch, I definitely recommend stopping by Sorabol.
author: Rodney H.

description: This wonton noodle soup is a joke. Perhaps it's the misleading name but the noodle is incredibly thick and mushy, and looks NOTHING like wonton noodle soup.
author: Alex C.

description: Probably one of the better choices at a food court. But alas, hard to rid itself of the food court image.
author: Howe L.

description: This is probably my go-to place in the metreon food court. Affordable, fast (most of the times), good variety in the combo plate (2 meat/veggie options + rice + Jap Chae + side veggies + kimchi) and pretty generous portion!
author: Jaclyn C.

description:
Good service can't even save this place. I ordered the tofu noodle soup (spicy). The broth was bland (and the hot sauce they gave me on the side was nasty). The tofu was abundant but flavorless. The noodles were lacking in texture and flavor. Try again, Sorabol.

I regretted not going to the Buckhorn Grill just 50 feet away...
author: Leana L.

description: Found an aluminum piece in my food. I told the manager or whoever looked like they were in charge, all she did was apologize, told the cashier to refund me and she quickly walked away. Their apology wasn't sincere. DO NOT EAT FROM HERE.
author: Karen J.

description:
Honestly it's not horrible for fast food Korean. 

Standard dishes with combos, etc.

Nothing else to really say - it's not special and it's not crappy.
author: Julia P.

description: Food was good, took them their sweet time though, they were not in a hurry at all, I waited for 20 minutes for an order of sliced beef and rice
author: Gael G.

description:
I don't usually get anything from Sorabol since Korean is a bit lacking in the vegetarian options area, but I decided to take a closer look at the menu and ordered my first ever bibimbap. It came with about 6 or 7 types of veggies with the option of either grilled or regular tofu. 

In general, it was ok but flavour-wise, it didn't blow my socks off. A coworker got the vegetable noodle soup and it looked uninteresting to me, so I doubt I'll try it again.
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Sorabol in the Metreon. order at the counter and prepped food (mostly $9 and under) broght quickly. soups are made as ordered .....

eats: spicy beef soup (8.95)
-"glass noodles, green onions, beef brisket, bean sprout, and rice"
-didnt't see any glass noodles, mostly shredded beef, bean sprouts, green onions, lots of chilis and evidently msg.
-ate about 1/2 and started coughing violently. (reaction to msg/spiciness).
-when i stopped coughing, i bagged remains of soup with rice and later gave it to an homeless person outside the building.

banchan:
-no side dishes given unless rice is counted as such.
-prices slightly higher here than at westfielde.
-lots of sitting in common area.
-service ok, signs needed to provide directions where to stand.
-entree value ok, soup value so so.
author: Victor G.

description:
I can't believe that this place had the longest line in the food court. I'm guessing they were attracted to the low prices, but certainly not the food. 


I had the combo plate with beef ribs and BBQ chicken. Both meats were overcooked and dry. The chicken was tough like leather. The rice was plain and tasteless. The noodles tasted okay, but the broccoli was ice cold--I would have thought a side veggie would be warm, at least. The chimchim (not sure how to spell it, but I'm not sure what it was either) was not good. 

All in all, maybe this is the absolute last time I eat at a food court. I've learned my lesson.
author: J M.

description:
Ok honestly, it was pretty tasty..... But I had a msg poisoning episode pretty much. Passed out and had dizziness for like four hours . I'm pretty sensitive to msg and I can always tell. Also ain't cheap. 

Two and not one star just because I guess if you aren't as sensitive as me and you don't mind is not being really authentic then.... Quick bite sure I guess.
author: Samson T.

description: Ordering food from Soranol Korean reminded me of the episode from the office when Michael goes to New York City.  He talks about this amazing pizza the has to have.  When he gets there they show him walking into Sabaros.  For the people that rate this five stars they need to expand their Korean food horizons.  It's fast food Korean it's good but not great.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Color me surprised! I was on break at work and decided to try Sorabol for the first time. For a mall food court restaurant, the lunch was on par with a lot of Korean restaurants I've tried. I ordered the spicy pork and beef and it was delicious!

Pros:
- Fast service
- Wide range of meat and vege options
- Tasty!

Cons:
- A bit expensive: $14 for a 2 item combination
- They charge extra vegetable toppings
author: Kelly J.

description: There aren't too many fast-food Korean places around, so if you are near Metreon and get a craving for quick Korean food, Sorabol will do the trick.  It may not be the greatest food around, but the portions are large and it'll fill you up.  All entrees come with rice (white or brown), chap chae (glass noodles), veggies (brocolli/carrots), and kimchi.  I'd probably opt for double chap chae and no rice if I come back.
author: Chris C.

description: The food was all right. It's not as good as the one in Westfield mall. They were a bit skimpy on the kimchi too :/
author: Brian P.

description: Good location in the mall plaza,nice display of meals for order. All the food is fresh. I ordered the BBQ Short Ribs with noodles broccoli. The ribs were very tasty,the noodles were good also. You also get good portions. I intend to go back and if the meals continue at this pace I would like to bump up the rating a star or two. Suffice to say its worth the money for a tasty meal.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
Another in Sorabol's line of mall quality Korean chow.  By default they'll give you about 1 pound of rice and 1 pound of greasy rice noodles.   Nothing on the menu is inspiring but they're usually fast and their proximity to Yerba Buena Park is key to the dining experience.

PROTIP: I recommend you go double rice instead of 50/50 on rice/noodles.
DOUBLE PROTIP: You can get broccoli instead of rice or noodles.
author: Ivan L.

description: Great Korean fast food!  I was here for one week long conference and visited them twice.  I always order the vegetable bowl for my veggie needs.  It's fresh and delicious, and comes with white/brown rice bottom and you can also can choose fish, tofu or other meat as topping.  I like that a lot, in fact I think they are better deal than Freshroll Vietnamese restaurant in the area.
author: Angela L.

description:
Sorabol  is kick-ass...just don't get their tofu noodle soup as I did earlier & get the kids meal!...Yes the kid meal...
When I first had their kids meal it got me SO full I couldn't finish it!!!
Really it's a bang for your buck IMO & it's customized & pretty delicious!
You can get a choice of either brown or white rice or noodles...OR you can opt for the half & half & get some rice & noodles, like I do! Then you choose your main "item" ie meat or tofu & you get some garnish at the end too.. like veggies & delicious kimchi & such!!! 
Whenever my wallet & my stomach is feeling empty and I'm in the area I would opt for some Sorabol!
author: Zhenya S.

description:
On one hand, it's fast food food court style, so don't set expectations too high. On the other, there are just...well, better to-go options for the same price.

I went for the spicy beef noodle soup - and it wasn't that impressive, I suppose. The beef was extremely tough, and the soup broth was...off. The noodles were okay I suppose, but it wasn't the best either. The portion is large, however, and the staff is nice. It just doesn't feel like it's worth the price.
author: Alex W.

description:
Lately I've been on a noodle binge and this week it lead me to the Sorabol at the Metreon.

I ordered the chicken ramen bowl and added beef, the Sorabol has a house vegetable mix they use for all their noodle bowls, which is fine.

I asked them to make it spicy and boy did they make it spicy!  I ate the spice ridden noodles but there was no way that I was I going to eat the broth because my asshole would have never forgave me. They also serve miso style, which I try next time.

The shredded beef they used for my ramen bowl was really good and I was really happy with the price, my ramen cost me 8$ plus tax. 

So all in all, I will be going back.
author: Charlie B.

description:
I've long been a fan of this Korean quick bite lunch option and was pleased to stumble upon it in the Metreon food court.

For under $10 you'll receive a bowl/plate filled with (white/brown) rice, vegetables, rice noodles and a choice of meat. While normally I'm a bulgogi girl all the way, their chicken preparation is mighty fine and I usually lean in that direction. Though don't get me wrong, the beef, short rib and stews have all been tasty in my experience. I always get the clear broth sauce poured on top of everything and it makes for a savory and filling feast. The food court offers plentiful seating and it's a nice quick meal to grab if you work in the area or are catching a movie after with some friends. 

Side note: it had been more than a year since I'd dined at Sorabol before this recent visit and I did get a bit of a stomach pang from the saltiness of it all. If you've been out of the brine game for a while, make sure to pace yourself.
author: Jane K.

description:
Lydia has exceptional customer service.  Friendly and quick! 

To everyone who gave negative reviews.... It's fast food people! So long as I'm full and the quality of food is yummy, I'm happy as clam. Can't ask for more.
author: Shenni C.

description:
Very disappointed with the food.  I had the two-item combo:  the sliced beef was a chewy gristly mess, and the BBQ chicken was bland and tough.  The chapchae was broken into small pieces - signs that it wasn't fresh or was prepared badly.  

The servers were also stingy on the portion:  I really feel cheated on how little food they put in my box.  The servers also seemed cold/mechanical - smile and say "thank you" to your customers, dammit!

The food at this location is WAAAAY worse than the Westfield mall location.  Stay away from this one.
author: Shin C.

description: There's something irresistible about Korean BBQ and a huge heaping of rice and japchae. The place is over-priced for the quality of fare, especially considering most of it is just carbs. I also find their BBQ to be overly saucy and a tad on the sweet side (and this is from someone that likes their savory dishes with a sweet note). The place is definitely a guilty pleasure and considering there aren't that many Korean joints in the area, a poor substitute, but then I take what I can get (sometimes).
author: Alice W.

description: The food is okay and I thought the portions were large for the money. A friend had an unexpected bone in his food. The line was super long and they start asking you what you want before you can even see the food.
author: Charles S.

description: Just no. I had fond memories of the Sorabol on Euclid Ave in Berkeley when I was a student, and wanted to try this place out when I saw it in the Metreon. It was pretty disappointing, but in hind sight, it's food court Asian food, so it all tastes the same.
author: roger t.

description: In late October of 2015, I had a couple visits to Sorabol, I love Korean food, so I always tend to lean towards trying other Korean places. I usually go to the Sorabol location inside Westfield's, but I was at the Metreon for a movie, so I gave this place a try. My first visit there was kind of rushed, it was around 5:45-6 and the employee was asking, "what would you like to order, soup?" I wasn't going to try a soup because I had a movie at 6:30, but she seemed very enthusiastic about selling the soup, so I ordered the spicy beef soup. I asked if this was the tofu stew, and she said I could add tofu for $1 or so, so I didn't the tofu. The food came pretty fast, they boiled the soup and poured it into the plastic bowl. The soup comes with a medium sized Chinese takeout container of rice and small container of kimchi. There was SO much rice and a huge bowl of soup! I am super pleased with the portion size, but the price was ($9.73 +tax). I left in about 8 minutes. I mean, I saved half for the next day as lunch. The soup was a little more salty than I had wanted, but the taste is of a more Americanized type of Korean food. I kinda expected that when there weren't any Korean people working there. I was craving Korean food so I went back to this same location. This time I ordered the 2 item combo with glass noodle, rice, chicken and beef stew in a bowl. I actually love their plastic bowls, it's a decent size (7" diameter). The noodles tasted good, but it only contained noodles, I thought this was jap chae with onions and some vegies, but nope, just seasoned noodles. The chicken was decent "food court" chicken, not bad but not the best either/kinda dry. But I love the beef stew! All the items except the rice was a little more salty than I usually eat, but the stew was amazing! They gave me two big scoops and the meat was tender, salty and sweet. The total for the 2 item combo was 10.82 +tax. Just like last time, I had plenty of leftovers and saved the rest for lunch the next day. I would go back for the stew and maybe some soup because I love Korean spicy soup.
author: Jennifer H.

description: The lemon chicken was okay. But the side dishes were pretty underwhelming and lacking flavor.
author: Ben Z.

description:
I love Korean food! 

JapChae: over-cooked, melts in the mouth, salty.
Bulgogee: boiled to death, tough, chewy, sweet.
Kalbee: slightly tough and chewy, smokey.
Sides: 3 pieces of broccoli is skimpy.
KimChee: generous serving of blandness.
author: Peggy C.

description:
This place is kind of like panda express for korean food (but without the crack-infused orange chicken). 

I had a two item bowl with spicy chicken and spicy pork. The flavors were not particularly authentic korean, but not bad considering it's in a mall food-court. 

The two item bowl is a TON of food though because they also give you both noodles and rice. However, they only gave me two small pieces of broccoli and a couple small pieces kimchi. They have a bunch of other banchan type vegetables in the case, not sure exactly how you get those, maybe with the bibimbap? It was also a little weird that the the mean sits in a different compartment than the rice/noodles. Seems like they should serve it rice bowl style instead.

I'll probably go back to this place because it's quick and nearby, but not the kind of place you tell friends they need to try.
author: Ely L.

description: Not much different from the Westfield one. Except I think they give smaller portions.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Great place for a hearty meal at a reasonable price. Food is served at a counter and seating is mall food court style.

I tried the spicy pork entree which came with sooo much food. First you have a choice of white and brown rice, next a choice of sides, and finally a choice of meat. I had glass noodle salad which were fantastic. Next they added some bulgobi (beef short ribs) on there, followed by the spicy pork (looks spicier than it is) and gobs of kimchee. The rice was finished off with teriyaki sauce. When I picked up my plate it was sagging from all the yummy food. Definitely a great value at $10.

When I dug in, the food was good, hearty, and satisfying. I am always concerned about the quality of the meat at Asian fast food restaurants. Not sure if it's a result of being precooked, but it always seems like the meat is dry and stringy and Sorabol was no exception. 

Overall great value and flavor for mall court food but my concerns about the quality of the meat prevent me from giving it 5 stars.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I'm usually only in this area if I'm watching a movie or for yet another tech conference. They usually have a pretty short line (probably since there are so many options now).

What is nice is you can get brown rice without getting charged more. I got the beef rib stew, I thought it was a little sweet.

I wasn't a big fan for the kimchee.
author: Carin C.

description: I was here for Dreamforce and also trying to maintain a healthy diet while in the city.  As I was leaving Target, I walked through the food court and found Sorabol looked the best.  I asked if it was possible for them to make a bowl for me that was only veggies and meat, no rice or noodles.  Without hesitating I was told yes and the gal piled my bowl full of delicious items ranging from sauteed veggies to pickled, even kimchi! Then it was piled with spicy pork.  Heaven! It was filling, amazing flavored and the people at the counter were more than happy to accommodate my diet.  I even went back again the next night for the same thing!
author: Julie R.

description: Ok- my previous 4 star analysis based on their pot stickers alone was foolish.  Last night I had a plate meal before going to a movie, and it was good- but not 4-star caliber (the pot stickers were, however).  Clear noodles, lemon chicken (good- nicely spiced), rice, veggies, kim chee...Good for mall food I guess, but not the class of the Metreon food court...
author: Andy S.

description: With the drop in temperatures, I got a hot soup here before my movie started (you get 15% your meal btw if you show proof that you're watching a movie upstairs).  I was disappointed with the soup.  The broth had very artificial flavor, the noodles tasted like rubber, and the tofu was definitely low quality.  Being that it's fast food, I couldn't complain too much.  But, the soup was over $7 so I was definitely hoping for better quality for what I paid.
author: Naomi P.

description: I wish I could give this sorry place a negative 5. The girl behind the counter tonight was classless and rude.  She made it a point to rip off a bite size chunk of the already meager amount of chicken that she put on the paper plate and throw it back into the metal warming bin.  Who trained this bimbo?!  The portions were an absolute joke - the Sorabol at Westfield *smokes* this joint in service, quantity AND quality.  The japchae noodles were stale, overcooked and tasted like crap.  The brown rice was very mushy = fail.  The BBQ chicken was dry, tough and bland.  Don't waste your hard earned bucks here, it's not worth it - stay away from this place!
author: Lawree S.

description: Pretty good for food court food! I got the spicy tofu and they give you a ton. I also loved the glass noodles. The broccoli was decent but didn't have much flavor. The man working there was really nice too :)
author: Alexandra W.

description: Not a bad place for lunch. I went on a rainy day in search of soup. I got the Spicy Beef Soup. It was really flavorful, and seemingly low carb. There was beef, bean sprouts, egg and onions. The option for rice was available, but I declined. The best part was that they made it right on the spot...not this morning, not last week. Right there! I would definitely go back. I gave it 3 stars because the staff seemed unorganized and confused about the whole ordering process....like it was the first time they had done it before or like it was their first day in business.
author: Gina T.

description:
New korean place opened up in metreon. 

FOOD: I had to wait for the short ribs to be cooked. It was fairly cooked in a good amount of time. Meat was tender and juicy. The kimchi was not too spicy. The little anchoives are my favorite. 

SERVICE: Service was okay. There were some that had to ask another colleague what item was what or how much it was...doesn't training require to know your items on the menu? 

PRICE: way too expensive! The one item meal is about $8...which I expected, but if you wanted to add more of those little side dishes that usually come with korean bbq they're about $1.50 each! I might as well go to another korean bbq place where it comes with the meal for free...

OVERALL: If I am desperately in that mood of korean bbq, I'd go back. Otherwise, if I need my asian fix, I might as well go back to Coriander. The food was great. It's more of the pricing and service I'm not too keen on. Try it yourself. Perhaps you will get a different experience.
author: Isabel N.

description: Nothing really stellar about this place, but nothing bad either.  Spicy BBQ chicken was nice and spicy, noodles were pretty good, brown rice was cooked well.  Doesn't compare to real Korean BBQ by any means,  but not a terrible choice if you're looking for some quick Korean food while at the Metreon
author: Bill R.

description: Never had kimchee this bland, cardboard probably has more flavor. Overpriced food, they should not even be allowed to call this Korean food. This sorry excuse of a fast food joint could be the reason why North Korea is building a nuclear bomb to use against us.
author: Steve M.

description: I was really excited to see a Korean fastfood joint on the way back home from work. Ive been dying to get my hands on some Korean grub for 3 months! What a dissapointment. I went for the Soondooboojeegae. Tofu soup. And it tasted like pure Korean spicy paste and was wayyyyy too salty. no eggs or side dishes ew
author: Sady C.

description: Got the bibimbap. Huge portions! Couldn't finish it. Pretty tasty. Fast and friendly service.
author: Christine R.

description:
This place sort of deserves 4 stars, because it's very tasty and the portions are really generous, but the BBQ Beef I had today was almost inedible.  It was shockingly tough and gristly.  

I had eaten there before and gotten the grilled chicken both times, and enjoyed it both times.  And the noodles, broccoli, and kimchi are all great.  Love that you can get brown rice instead of white.

However, the beef I had today was unacceptably bad.  Hopefully this was just an off batch of meat, or maybe they can change the cut they use... but something's gotta change.
author: Angie B.

description: Wanted to like it, the food LOOKED yummy, it just had no taste whatsoever. My boyfriend got the 2 item combo plate with the spicy chicken and spicy beef. While it was a great deal of food for $9.95, there wasn't any flavor. I opted for the tofu/veggie noodle soup in miso broth and it tasted like steamed veggies in boiling water :( Service with a smile, but wouldn't recommend the food.
author: Tori M.

description: Looks like the Metreon is on its way back...in that it always had a spirit of a place that was one time pretty cool...but sort of lacking...but with a few new businesses it looks like the metreon is on the way up! Sorabol just opened...like a few hours ago.  And it didn't even seem to have any first day issues...everything went smoothly...food was decent (think mall food) but the giveaway was that there was no menu sign.  So everything was a bit of a mystery.  Apparently it was overlooked as everyone was just focusing on the construction.  Rest assured its on its way...would i make a trip to the metreon for this place.  No...but is it a good choice if I happen to be there to see a movie and I have a limited time and perhaps a limited budget...absolutely.  The staff was super friendly too!
author: Kierstan G.

description: I wish that I had read some of the other reviews or took the sign that this was the only place without a line...it was horrible.  I generally like Korean food but this misses the mark - even if just fast food.  Don't do it...much better options out there.
author: Ryan O.

description: Same food as the other spots,  I wanted to try this location out since it was an amazing day outside in SF and this location sits right on the Yerba Buena gardens.  There was huge line as Oracle World is in town.  The line moved very quick and the service was fast and friendly.  I had the to 2 entree special, Spicy Bar-B-Que Chicken and the Beef Rib Stew, with brown rice.  It also came with Kimchi which was a little bland.  The spicy chicken was was very good, nice tangy sauce and the chicken was cook just right.  The Beef Rib was OK, the beef was over cooked and a little chewy.  The sauce and the veggies where fine.  Overall a decent meal but a tad bit expensive for lunch $12.00 which included organic mango Oolong tea.  Yes for location and access to the great outdoors in the middle of SF!
author: Prescott R.

description: Very weak and tasteless vegetable and tofu noodle soup. There are much better options in this food court.
author: Frank L.

description: Not going back.  Used to be a favorite, now prices have gone up, and portions have gone down.  Worst yet is the unfriendly attitude of their servers.  It's too bad that the whole food court has suffered after Borders moved out, but, really, you have to do better on food and service to keep people coming.  Plenty of other better Korean options.
author: Jim W.

description: So excited to have Sorabol near my office.  This place service of some of the most generous portions of tasty Korean morsels this side of Seoul.  Really like seeing many of the Korean side dishes that I love so much.   They did a nice job remodeling the Metreon food court and the free wifi is a plus.   Spicy Pork and grilled chicken are incredible.   Run don't walk to this place.
author: Sven B.
